intro: Leandra rufescens var. asperiuscula, commonly known as the rough-leaved leandra, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its thick, rough-textured leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters during the warmer months. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and requires partial to full sunlight. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in subtropical gardens.
